NAME: Date
DESC: Generates a custom formatted date/datetime/time between whatever two dates you specify.
help_D: A textual representation of a day, three letters
help_F: A full textual representation of a month, such as January or March
help_L_example: 1 if it is a leap year, 0 otherwise.
help_M: A short textual representation of a month, three letters
help_S: English ordinal suffix for the day of the month, 2 characters st, nd, rd or th. Works well with j
help_W: ISO-8601 week number of year, weeks starting on Monday
help_Y: A full numeric representation of a year, 4 digits
help_d: Day of the month, 2 digits with leading zeros
help_intro: This data type randomly generates a date between the dates specified, and allows for unique formatting of the result. See the table below for a list of viable formatting rules (these are cribbed from the standard PHP date() formatting options). Take a look at the example dropdown to select from existing formatting options.
help_j: Day of the month without leading zeros
help_l: A full textual representation of the day of the week
help_m: Numeric representation of a month, with leading zeros
help_n: Numeric representation of a month, without leading zeros
help_t: Number of days in the given month
help_w: Numeric representation of the day of the week
help_y: A two digit representation of a year
help_z: The day of the year (starting from 0)
incomplete_fields: Dates needs to have the format entered in the Options text field. Please fix the following rows:
